intro: Eleocharis diandra, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescence composed of numerous small, spike-like clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes, swamps, and the edges of ponds. Its slender stems and inconspicuous flowers make it difficult to distinguish from other similar rush species without close examination. Eleocharis diandra plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic environments and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
